metadata.title: CVE-2021-3669 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. Measuring usage of the shared memorydoes not scale with large shared memory segment counts which could lead toresource exhaustion and DoS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-146-generic - 5.4.0-146.163
linux-image-5.4.0-146-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-146.163
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-146-generic - 5.4.0-146.163
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-146-lowlatency - 5.4.0-146.163
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1088-kvm - 5.4.0-1088.94
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-146.163').
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11, was needed').
linux-kvm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1088.94').
linux-aws package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1099.107').
linux-aws-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.11, was needs-triage').
